title: Mice in Bion-M 1 space mission: training and selection
summary: Mice were carefully trained and selected for the Bion-M 1 space mission to test how mammals adapt to the stress of spaceflight.

title: Microgravity induces pelvic bone loss through osteoclastic activity, osteocytic osteolysis, and osteoblastic cell cycle inhibition by CDKN1a/p21
summary: Bone loss in microgravity happens because bone cells break down faster and their growth cycle is slowed by a key protein (CDKN1a/p21).

title: Stem Cell Health and Tissue Regeneration in Microgravity
summary: Stem cells exposed to microgravity show reduced ability to repair and regenerate tissues, raising concerns for long-term astronaut health.

title: Microgravity Reduces the Differentiation and Regenerative Potential of Embryonic Stem Cells
summary: Embryonic stem cells in microgravity fail to properly mature into specialized cells, limiting their ability to regenerate tissues.

title: Microgravity validation of a novel system for RNA isolation and multiplex quantitative real time PCR analysis of gene expression on the International Space Station
summary: A new system was successfully tested on the ISS to isolate RNA and analyze multiple genes at once, improving biological experiments in space.
